## Mastodon Install guide

```shell
curl --silent --location https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_8.x | bash -  
wget https://dl.yarnpkg.com/rpm/yarn.repo -O /etc/yum.repos.d/yarn.repo  
rpm -Uvh https://download.postgresql.org/pub/repos/yum/9.6/redhat/rhel-7-x86_64/pgdg-centos96-9.6-3.noarch.rpm  
  
wget https://github.com/CasjaysDev/packages/raw/main/rhel/mastodon.txt -O /tmp/mastodon.txt  
yum install -y $(cat /tmp/mastodon.txt)  
  
/usr/pgsql-9.6/bin/postgresql96-setup initdb  
  
systemctl start postgresql-9.6 redis  
systemctl enable postgresql-9.6 redis  
  
vim /var/lib/pgsql/9.6/data/pg_hba.conf  
  
# TYPE  DATABASE        USER            ADDRESS                 METHOD  
  
# "local" is for Unix domain socket connections only  
local   all             all                                     trust  
# IPv4 local connections:  
host    all             all             127.0.0.1/32            md5  
# IPv6 local connections:  
host    all             all             ::1/128                 md5  
  
adduser mastodon  
su - mastodon  
gpg --keyserver hkp://keys.gnupg.net --recv-keys 409B6B1796C275462A1703113804BB82D39DC0E3 7D2BAF1CF37B13E2069D6956105BD0E739499BDB  
curl -sSL https://get.rvm.io | bash -s stable  
source /home/mastodon/.rvm/scripts/rvm  
rvm install 2.5.1  
  
gem install bundler  
cd ~  
git clone https://github.com/tootsuite/mastodon.git app  
cd ~/app  
git checkout $(git describe --tags `git rev-list --tags --max-count=1`)  
bundle config build.pg --with-pg-config=/usr/pgsql-9.6/bin/pg_config  
bundle install --deployment --without development test  
exit  
  
passwd postgres  
su - postgres -c psql  
CREATE USER mastodon CREATEDB;  
ALTER USER mastodon WITH ENCRYPTED password 'YOURSECUREPASSWORD' CREATEDB;  
\q  
  
su - mastodon  
cd ~/app  
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rake mastodon:setup  
  
su -  
git clone https://github.com/casjay-base/howtos /tmp/howtos
cp -Rfv /tmp/howtos/mastodon/{etc,usr}* /  
  
systemctl daemon-reload  
systemctl enable mastodon-web mastodon-queue mastodon-api  
systemctl start mastodon-web mastodon-queue mastodon-api  
systemctl status mastodon-web mastodon-queue mastodon-api  
```

guides.readmeRaw:
# Mattermost Installation Guide

Open-source, self-hosted team communication platform with enterprise-grade security. Complete alternative to Slack with advanced features for secure collaboration, workflow automation, and integrated voice/video calling.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (any modern distribution)
- Root or sudo access
- 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB+ recommended for production
- PostgreSQL 11+ or MySQL 8.0+ database
- NGINX reverse proxy (recommended for production)
- Domain name and SSL certificate for HTTPS

## Installation

### Ubuntu/Debian (Recommended)
```bash
# Update system packages
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y

# Download latest Mattermost server
MATTERMOST_VERSION="9.2.4"  # Check for latest at https://mattermost.com/download
wget https://releases.mattermost.com/${MATTERMOST_VERSION}/mattermost-${MATTERMOST_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz

# Extract and install
tar -xzf mattermost-${MATTERMOST_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz
sudo mv mattermost /opt/

# Create system user
sudo useradd --system --user-group mattermost
sudo chown -R mattermost:mattermost /opt/mattermost

# Create data directory
sudo mkdir -p /opt/mattermost/data
sudo chown mattermost:mattermost /opt/mattermost/data
sudo chmod 755 /opt/mattermost/data

# Set proper permissions
sudo find /opt/mattermost -type d -exec chmod 755 {} \;
sudo find /opt/mattermost -type f -exec chmod 644 {} \;
sudo chmod +x /opt/mattermost/bin/mattermost

# Create log directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/log/mattermost
sudo chown mattermost:mattermost /var/log/mattermost
```

### RHEL/CentOS/Rocky Linux/AlmaLinux
```bash
# Install prerequisites
sudo yum update -y
sudo yum install -y wget tar

# Download and install Mattermost
MATTERMOST_VERSION="9.2.4"
wget https://releases.mattermost.com/${MATTERMOST_VERSION}/mattermost-${MATTERMOST_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz
tar -xzf mattermost-${MATTERMOST_VERSION}-linux-amd64.tar.gz
sudo mv mattermost /opt/

# Create system user and directories
sudo useradd --system --user-group mattermost
sudo chown -R mattermost:mattermost /opt/mattermost
sudo mkdir -p /opt/mattermost/data /var/log/mattermost
sudo chown mattermost:mattermost /opt/mattermost/data /var/log/mattermost

# Configure firewall
sudo firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=8065/tcp
sudo firewall-cmd --reload
```

### Docker Installation (Production Ready)
```bash
# Create Mattermost directory structure
mkdir -p ~/mattermost/{config,data,logs,plugins,client-plugins}

# Create Docker Compose configuration
cat > ~/mattermost/docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'

services:
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    container_name: mattermost-postgres
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_DB=mattermost
      - POSTGRES_USER=mattermost
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=secure_postgres_password_2024
      - POSTGRES_INITDB_ARGS="--encoding=UTF8 --lc-collate=C --lc-ctype=C"
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./postgres-custom.conf:/etc/postgresql/postgresql.conf
    networks:
      - mattermost
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    read_only: true
    tmpfs:
      - /tmp
      - /var/run/postgresql

  mattermost:
    image: mattermost/mattermost-enterprise-edition:latest
    container_name: mattermost
    restart: unless-stopped
    depends_on:
      - postgres
    environment:
      # Database settings
      - MM_SQLSETTINGS_DRIVERNAME=postgres
      - MM_SQLSETTINGS_DATASOURCE=postgres://mattermost:secure_postgres_password_2024@postgres:5432/mattermost?sslmode=disable&connect_timeout=10
      
      # Server settings
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_SITEURL=https://mattermost.example.com
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_LISTENADDRESS=:8000
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_ENABLELINKPREVIEWS=true
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_ENABLEDEVELOPER=false
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_ENABLESECURITYFIXALERT=true
      - MM_SERVICESETTINGS_ENABLEINSECUREOUTGOINGCONNECTIONS=false
      
      # File settings
      - MM_FILESETTINGS_MAXFILESIZE=104857600  # 100MB
      - MM_FILESETTINGS_DRIVERNAME=local
      - MM_FILESETTINGS_DIRECTORY=/mattermost/data
      
      # Email settings (configure SMTP)
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_ENABLESIGNUPWITHEMAIL=false
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_ENABLESIGNINWITHEMAIL=true
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_ENABLESIGNINWITHUSERNAME=true
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_SMTPSERVER=smtp.example.com
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_SMTPPORT=587
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_SMTPUSERNAME=mattermost@example.com
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_SMTPPASSWORD=smtp_secure_password
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_ENABLESMTPAUTH=true
      - MM_EMAILSETTINGS_CONNECTIONSECURITY=STARTTLS
      
      # Security settings
      - MM_TEAMSETTINGS_ENABLEOPENSERVER=false
      - MM_TEAMSETTINGS_ENABLEUSERCREATION=false
      - MM_TEAMSETTINGS_RESTRICTCREATIONTODOMAIN=example.com
      - MM_PASSWORDSETTINGS_MINIMUMLENGTH=12
      - MM_PASSWORDSETTINGS_REQUIRELOWERCASE=true
      - MM_PASSWORDSETTINGS_REQUIREUPPERCASE=true
      - MM_PASSWORDSETTINGS_REQUIRENUMBER=true
      - MM_PASSWORDSETTINGS_REQUIRESYMBOL=true
      
      # Session settings
      - MM_SESSIONSETTINGS_SESSIONLENGTHWEBINHOURS=720  # 30 days
      - MM_SESSIONSETTINGS_SESSIONLENGTHMOBILEINHOURS=720
      - MM_SESSIONSETTINGS_ENABLEUSERACCESSTOKENS=false
      
      # Rate limiting
      - MM_RATELIMITSETTINGS_ENABLE=true
      - MM_RATELIMITSETTINGS_PERSEC=10
      - MM_RATELIMITSETTINGS_MAXBURST=100
      
      # Privacy settings
      - MM_PRIVACYSETTINGS_SHOWEMAILADDRESS=false
      - MM_PRIVACYSETTINGS_SHOWFULLNAME=false
      
      # Logging
      - MM_LOGSETTINGS_ENABLECONSOLE=true
      - MM_LOGSETTINGS_CONSOLELEVEL=INFO
      - MM_LOGSETTINGS_ENABLEFILE=true
      - MM_LOGSETTINGS_FILELEVEL=INFO
      - MM_LOGSETTINGS_FILELOCATION=/mattermost/logs/mattermost.log
      
    volumes:
      - ./config:/mattermost/config:rw
      - ./data:/mattermost/data:rw
      - ./logs:/mattermost/logs:rw
      - ./plugins:/mattermost/plugins:rw
      - ./client-plugins:/mattermost/client/plugins:rw
    ports:
      - "127.0.0.1:8065:8000"  # Bind to localhost only
    networks:
      - mattermost
    security_opt:
      - no-new-privileges:true
    read_only: true
    tmpfs:
      - /tmp

networks:
  mattermost:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  postgres_data:
EOF

# Start Mattermost stack
cd ~/mattermost
docker-compose up -d

# Check logs
docker-compose logs -f mattermost
```

### Kubernetes Installation (Enterprise)
```bash
# Install Mattermost Operator
kubectl create namespace mattermost-operator

# Install via Helm
helm repo add mattermost https://helm.mattermost.com
helm repo update

helm install mattermost-operator mattermost/mattermost-operator \
  --namespace mattermost-operator \
  --set image.tag=v2.0.0

# Create Mattermost cluster configuration
cat > mattermost-cluster.yaml <<EOF
apiVersion: mattermost.com/v1alpha1
kind: Mattermost
metadata:
  name: mattermost
  namespace: mattermost
spec:
  size: 1000users  # Adjust based on user count
  ingressName: mattermost.example.com
  version: v9.2.4
  
  database:
    external:
      url: "postgres://mattermost:secure_password@postgres.example.com:5432/mattermost?sslmode=require"
  
  fileStore:
    external:
      url: "s3://mattermost-files"
      bucket: "mattermost-files"
      region: "us-west-2"
      
  elasticSearch:
    host: "elasticsearch.example.com:9200"
    username: "mattermost"
    password: "elasticsearch_password"
    
  blueGreen:
    enable: true
    productionDeployment: blue
    
  resourceRequests:
    cpu: "1000m"
    memory: "2Gi"
    
  resourceLimits:
    cpu: "2000m" 
    memory: "4Gi"
    
  affinity:
    podAntiAffinity:
      requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
        - labelSelector:
            matchExpressions:
              - key: app
                operator: In
                values:
                  - mattermost
          topologyKey: kubernetes.io/hostname
          
  livenessProbe:
    httpGet:
      path: /api/v4/system/ping
      port: 8000
    initialDelaySeconds: 30
    periodSeconds: 10
    
  readinessProbe:
    httpGet:
      path: /api/v4/system/ping
      port: 8000
    initialDelaySeconds: 15
    periodSeconds: 5
EOF

kubectl apply -f mattermost-cluster.yaml
```

## Database Configuration

### PostgreSQL Setup (Recommended)
```bash
# Install PostgreSQL 15
sudo apt install -y postgresql-15 postgresql-client-15

# Create Mattermost database and user
sudo -u postgres psql <<EOF
CREATE DATABASE mattermost WITH ENCODING 'UTF8' LC_COLLATE='en_US.UTF-8' LC_CTYPE='en_US.UTF-8' TEMPLATE=template0;
CREATE USER mattermost WITH ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'MattermostDBPassword2024!';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE mattermost TO mattermost;

-- Performance optimization for Mattermost
ALTER SYSTEM SET shared_buffers = '1GB';
ALTER SYSTEM SET effective_cache_size = '3GB';
ALTER SYSTEM SET work_mem = '16MB';
ALTER SYSTEM SET maintenance_work_mem = '256MB';
ALTER SYSTEM SET checkpoint_completion_target = 0.9;
ALTER SYSTEM SET wal_buffers = '16MB';
ALTER SYSTEM SET random_page_cost = 1.1;

-- Mattermost-specific settings
ALTER DATABASE mattermost SET default_text_search_config = 'pg_catalog.english';

SELECT pg_reload_conf();
EOF

# Configure PostgreSQL for Mattermost
sudo tee -a /etc/postgresql/15/main/postgresql.conf > /dev/null <<EOF

# Mattermost optimizations
max_connections = 300
shared_preload_libraries = 'pg_stat_statements'
track_activity_query_size = 2048
pg_stat_statements.track = all
EOF

sudo systemctl restart postgresql
```

### MySQL 8.0 Setup (Alternative)
```bash
# Install MySQL 8.0
sudo apt install -y mysql-server

# Secure installation
sudo mysql_secure_installation

# Create Mattermost database
mysql -u root -p <<EOF
CREATE DATABASE mattermost CHARACTER SET utf8mb4 COLLATE utf8mb4_unicode_ci;
CREATE USER 'mattermost'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'MattermostDBPassword2024!';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON mattermost.* TO 'mattermost'@'localhost';

-- MySQL optimization for Mattermost
SET GLOBAL innodb_buffer_pool_size = 1073741824;  -- 1GB
SET GLOBAL max_connections = 300;
SET GLOBAL wait_timeout = 600;
SET GLOBAL interactive_timeout = 600;

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF
```

## Backup and Monitoring

### Backup Strategy
```bash
sudo tee /usr/local/bin/mattermost-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/mattermost"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}/{database,config,data,plugins}

echo "Starting Mattermost backup..."

# Stop Mattermost service
systemctl stop mattermost

# Backup database
sudo -u postgres pg_dump mattermost > ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mattermost-${DATE}.sql
gzip ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mattermost-${DATE}.sql

# Backup configuration
cp /opt/mattermost/config/config.json ${BACKUP_DIR}/config/config-${DATE}.json

# Backup user data and files
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/data/mattermost-data-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /opt/mattermost data/

# Backup plugins
if [ -d "/opt/mattermost/plugins" ]; then
    tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/plugins/mattermost-plugins-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /opt/mattermost plugins/
fi

# Start Mattermost
systemctl start mattermost

# Upload to cloud storage
aws s3 cp ${BACKUP_DIR}/ s3://mattermost-backups/ --recursive
gsutil cp -r ${BACKUP_DIR}/* gs://mattermost-backups/

# Keep last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "mattermost-*" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Mattermost backup completed: ${DATE}"
EOF

sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/mattermost-backup.sh
```

    Backup and Monitoring

    Backup Strategy

    bash 
    sudo tee /usr/local/bin/mattermost-backup.sh > /dev/null <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
BACKUP_DIR="/backup/mattermost"
DATE=$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S)

mkdir -p ${BACKUP_DIR}/{database,config,data,plugins}

echo "Starting Mattermost backup..."

# Stop Mattermost service
systemctl stop mattermost

# Backup database
sudo -u postgres pg_dump mattermost > ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mattermost-${DATE}.sql
gzip ${BACKUP_DIR}/database/mattermost-${DATE}.sql

# Backup configuration
cp /opt/mattermost/config/config.json ${BACKUP_DIR}/config/config-${DATE}.json

# Backup user data and files
tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/data/mattermost-data-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /opt/mattermost data/

    tar -czf ${BACKUP_DIR}/plugins/mattermost-plugins-${DATE}.tar.gz -C /opt/mattermost plugins/

# Start Mattermost

# Upload to cloud storage
aws s3 cp ${BACKUP_DIR}/ s3://mattermost-backups/ --recursive
gsutil cp -r ${BACKUP_DIR}/* gs://mattermost-backups/

# Keep last 7 backups
find ${BACKUP_DIR} -name "mattermost-*" -type f -mtime +7 -delete

echo "Mattermost backup completed: ${DATE}"

# Rocket.Chat Installation Guide

Open-source team communication platform with features like real-time messaging, video calls, file sharing, and extensive integrations.

## Prerequisites

- Linux system (Ubuntu/Debian, RHEL/CentOS, or compatible)
- 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended
- MongoDB 4.4+ or 5.0+
- Node.js 14.x
- Domain name (for SSL setup)

## Installation

### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)
```bash
# Create project directory
mkdir -p ~/rocketchat && cd ~/rocketchat

# Create docker-compose.yml
cat > docker-compose.yml <<EOF
version: '3.8'

services:
  rocketchat:
    image: registry.rocket.chat/rocketchat/rocket.chat:latest
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGO_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/rocketchat?replicaSet=rs0"
      MONGO_OPLOG_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/local?replicaSet=rs0"
      ROOT_URL: "https://chat.example.com"
      PORT: 3000
      DEPLOY_METHOD: docker
      REG_TOKEN: \${REG_TOKEN}
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    volumes:
      - ./uploads:/app/uploads
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo:
    image: docker.io/bitnami/mongodb:5.0
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_MODE: primary
      MONGODB_REPLICA_SET_NAME: rs0
      MONGODB_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_HOST: mongo
      MONGODB_INITIAL_PRIMARY_PORT_NUMBER: 27017
      MONGODB_ADVERTISED_HOSTNAME: mongo
      MONGODB_ENABLE_JOURNAL: true
      ALLOW_EMPTY_PASSWORD: yes
    volumes:
      - mongodb_data:/bitnami/mongodb
    networks:
      - rocketchat

  mongo-express:
    image: mongo-express
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      ME_CONFIG_MONGODB_URL: "mongodb://mongo:27017/"
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_USERNAME: admin
      ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_PASSWORD: pass
    ports:
      - "8081:8081"
    depends_on:
      - mongo
    networks:
      - rocketchat

networks:
  rocketchat:
    driver: bridge

volumes:
  mongodb_data:
EOF

# Start services
docker-compose up -d

# Check logs
docker-compose logs -f rocketchat
```

### Manual Installation (Ubuntu/Debian)

#### MongoDB Setup
```bash
# Install MongoDB
wget -qO - https://www.mongodb.org/static/pgp/server-5.0.asc | sudo apt-key add -
echo "deb [ arch=amd64,arm64 ] https://repo.mongodb.org/apt/ubuntu focal/mongodb-org/5.0 multiverse" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mongodb-org-5.0.list

sudo apt update
sudo apt install -y mongodb-org

# Configure MongoDB as replica set
sudo systemctl enable --now mongod

# Initialize replica set
mongo --eval "rs.initiate({_id: 'rs0', members: [{_id: 0, host: 'localhost:27017'}]})"

# Create Rocket.Chat database user
mongo rocketchat --eval "db.createUser({user: 'rocketchat', pwd: 'secure_password', roles: [{role: 'readWrite', db: 'rocketchat'}]})"
```

#### Node.js and Rocket.Chat Setup
```bash
# Install Node.js 14.x
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_14.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt install -y nodejs

# Create rocketchat user
sudo useradd -m -s /bin/bash rocketchat

# Download and install Rocket.Chat
cd /opt
sudo wget https://releases.rocket.chat/latest/download -O rocket.chat.tgz
sudo tar -xzf rocket.chat.tgz
sudo mv bundle Rocket.Chat
sudo chown -R rocketchat:rocketchat /opt/Rocket.Chat

# Install dependencies
cd /opt/Rocket.Chat/programs/server
sudo -u rocketchat npm install

# Set environment variables
sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/rocketchat.service > /dev/null <<EOF
[Unit]
Description=The Rocket.Chat server
After=network.target remote-fs.target nss-lookup.target nginx.service mongod.service
Wants=network.target

[Service]
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/node /opt/Rocket.Chat/main.js
StandardOutput=syslog
StandardError=syslog
SyslogIdentifier=rocketchat
User=rocketchat
Group=rocketchat
Environment=MONGO_URL=mongodb://rocketchat:secure_password@localhost:27017/rocketchat?authSource=rocketchat&replicaSet=rs0
Environment=MONGO_OPLOG_URL=mongodb://rocketchat:secure_password@localhost:27017/local?authSource=admin&replicaSet=rs0
Environment=ROOT_URL=https://chat.example.com
Environment=PORT=3000

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
EOF

# Enable and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl enable --now rocketchat
```

### Snap Installation (Easiest)
```bash
# Install Rocket.Chat via snap
sudo snap install rocketchat-server

# Configure
sudo snap set rocketchat-server mongodb-url="mongodb://localhost:27017/parties"
sudo snap set rocketchat-server root-url="https://chat.example.com"
sudo snap set rocketchat-server port=3000

# Start service
sudo systemctl enable --now snap.rocketchat-server.rocketchat-server
```

## Configuration

### NGINX Reverse Proxy
```bash
# Create NGINX configuration
sudo tee /etc/nginx/sites-available/rocketchat > /dev/null <<EOF
# Upstreams
upstream backend {
    server 127.0.0.1:3000;
}

# HTTPS Server
server {
    listen 443 ssl http2;
    server_name chat.example.com;

    # SSL Configuration
    ssl_certificate /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/fullchain.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /etc/letsencrypt/live/chat.example.com/privkey.pem;
    ssl_protocols TLSv1.2 TLSv1.3;
    ssl_ciphers ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE-RSA-AES256-GCM-SHA384;
    ssl_prefer_server_ciphers off;

    # Security headers
    add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN";
    add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block";
    add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff";
    add_header Referrer-Policy "no-referrer-when-downgrade";
    add_header Strict-Transport-Security "max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains" always;

    # Proxy settings
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://backend;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade \$http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host \$http_host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP \$remote_addr;
```

    MongoDB Replica Set (Multi-node)

    # On each MongoDB node, configure replica set

replication:

net:

EOF

# Initialize replica set (run on primary node only)
mongo --eval "
rs.initiate({
  _id: 'rs0',
  members: [
    {_id: 0, host: 'mongo1.example.com:27017', priority: 2},
    {_id: 1, host: 'mongo2.example.com:27017', priority: 1},
    {_id: 2, host: 'mongo3.example.com:27017', priority: 1, arbiterOnly: true}
  ]
});
"
